itemLabel: Walter Marshall, Baron Marshall of Goring

wikipedia_page.main: Walter Charles Marshall, Baron Marshall of Goring  (5 March 1932 in Rumney, Cardiff – 20 February 1996, in London) was a noted theoretical physicist and leader in the UK's energy sector.

response: * Walter Marshall, Baron Marshall of Goring from 1982 to 1989,
*Walter Marshall, Baron Marshall of Goring (1932–1996), British physicist and chairman of the Central Electricity Generating Board
*Walter Marshall, Baron Marshall of Goring (1932–1996), British nuclear physicist
* Walter Marshall, Baron Marshall of Goring (1932–1996), theoretical physicist

In 1988 the then chairman of the CEGB Walter Marshall, Baron Marshall of Goring announced a 2 x 900 MW coal-fired power station fitted with flue-gas desulfurisation (FGD) to be known as 'West Burton B' would be built on the site. The plan was abandoned just before privatisation.
#REDIRECT Walter Marshall, Baron Marshall of Goring

*Walter Marshall, Baron Marshall of Goring, 63, British physicist and businessman (b. 1932)
* Walter Marshall, Baron Marshall of Goring, Chairman from 1982-89 of the Central Electricity Generating Board (CEGB)

link_mentions.page: List of fellows of the Royal Society elected in 1971

response: Glyn started working for the Central Electricity Generating Board as an electrical engineer supervising installation work. He finished up as chairman from 1977 to 1982, taking over from Sir Arthur Hawkins and being replaced by Walter Marshall, Baron Marshall of Goring.
